channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'On day 1, I will fire...': 10 things Donald Trump said at Bitcoin 2024 conference
item.description: ​Former president and Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump addressed Saturday Bitcoin 2024 conference in Nashville taking an opposite stand that earlier when he declared bitcoin was not money. At the conference, he said America will be the crypto capital in the coming days if he is back to the White House. Bitcoin stands for freedom, sovereignty, and independence from government, coercion, and control, Trump said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance's old friend leaks shocking email exchange: 'He wishes Sofia all the best'
item.description: JD Vance, Donald Trump's running mate in the upcoming election, was once a Trump hater and Vance's campaign has not tried to put a fig-leaf onto it. They said Vance's opinion about Trump evolved over the ages. Now an old friend of Vance, Sofia Nelson, who identifies himself as a transgender, has leaked his old private mail exchanges with Vance -- to the New York Times hoping that voters would be now well informed about Mr Vance -- who already is at the center of a major controversy for his past remark on 'childless cat ladies'.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Andy Roddick says it doesn't matter if Trump was hit by bullet or sharpnel because...
item.description: ​Tennis legend Andy Roddick said it does not matter whether former president Donald Trump was hit by a bullet or a sharpnel as it does not change the fact that there was an assassination attempt on him. The comment came as FBI director Christopher Wray earlier this week expressed some doubt over what actually grazed Trump's right year at his rally in Pennsylvania. FBI, however, clarified later that Trump was injured by a bullet.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Astrologer's 2020 post on Kamala running for President viral. 'Trump winning?' Internet asks her
item.description: ​A 2020 post by clairvoyant Amy Tripp, who goes by the name Starheal, has gone viral as in the post it was predicted that Kamala Harris will be running for the president post in 2024. "Kamala Harris will be 60 in 4 years. I see her running for Presidenyt in 2024 since this coincides with her Saturn return," the 2020 post read.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Usha Vance used to be appalled by Trump, it was surreal to see her next to him'
item.description: ​Usha Chilukuri Vance, the Indian-origin wife of senator JD Vance who could be the next vice president, used to be appalled by Donald Trump and it was surreal to see her next to Trump at the Republican National Convention, her old friends told Washington Post. Usha was registered as a Democrat almost a decade ago but was not vocal about politics. Her friends said she was actually repulsed by Trump after his January 6, 2021 action.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least 9 killed and several injured after rocket barrage from Lebanon struck Israel annexed Golan Heights
item.description: A rocket barrage from Lebanon killed nine and wounded 34, including 17 critically, in the Golan Heights. Israel blamed Hezbollah for the attack and is preparing a response. An Israeli airstrike on southern Lebanon killed three Hezbollah members, escalating tension. The conflict between Israel and Hezbollah has intensified since the war in Gaza began after Hamas’ attack on October 7.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Disgusting': JD Vance on Jennifer Aniston's 'I pray your daughter...' remark
item.description: Ohio senator and Republican party's vice presidential candidate JD Vance said it's disgusting that a Hollywood celebrity commented on her two-year-old daughter and prayed that she should never face fertility problems. In the Megyn Kelly show where JD Vance defended her 'childless cat ladies' comment, without naming Jennifer Aniston, he said it was disgusting.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: South Africa cancels visas of 95 Libyans detained at military-style camp
item.description: South Africa detained 95 Libyans at a camp in Mpumalanga, suspected to be an illicit military training base. Visas issued in Tunis were revoked, having been falsely acquired. The Libyans, originally allowed in for security guard training, have no clear affiliation, and the situation is under investigation, awaiting top officials' visit.

item.title: Donald Trump tells Christians they won't have to vote after this election
item.description: Donald Trump told Christians that if they vote for him in November, they won't need to vote again, claiming he would fix everything in four years. This statement was made at an event by Turning Point Action in Florida, amidst accusations from Democrats of him being a threat to democracy. The Trump campaign did not clarify his comments.

item.title: Kamala Harris focuses on 3 as potential V-P candidates
item.description: Kamala Harris has begun vetting potential running mates for her presidential bid, considering top Democratic figures like Mark Kelly, Josh Shapiro, and Tim Walz. Harris officially declared her candidacy, targeting a decision by August 7. Selecting a vice presidential candidate is crucial for her campaign as she challenges Republican nominee Donald Trump in the November election.

item.title: US, China seek stability amid tensions
item.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi met in Vientiane, Laos, to discuss stability and security issues, including Taiwan and the South China Sea. They agreed to progress on military communications and discussed China's agreement with the Philippines on vessel movements. Wang Yi expressed China's concerns over perceived US constraints on its policies.

item.title: Trump gets upstaged by RFK Jr's claims of 'Bitcoin Fort Knox'
item.description: Former President Donald Trump was reported to consider creating a government reserve of Bitcoin, according to Robert F Kennedy Jr Kennedy claimed Trump might announce plans to buy one million Bitcoin if re-elected. Kennedy further promised to direct the Treasury to buy Bitcoin daily if he wins. Trump's campaign did not comment.

item.title: Now, a Greek island seeks cap on tourist inflow
item.description: Tourism in Santorini has surged with millions visiting, straining infrastructure and driving housing costs up, leading residents to call for limits. In other news, Australia has banned uranium mining at the Jabiluka site, and Abbott Laboratories faces a nearly $500 million verdict over infant formula risks.

item.title: Why artificial intelligence often struggles with math
item.description: AI chatbots like ChatGPT were praised for their language skills but struggled with math due to their design focused on probabilities, not rule-based calculations. Scholars emphasized the need for tools like calculator programs for accuracy. This highlighted a debate in the AI community on whether current neural networks are sufficient for achieving artificial general intelligence.

item.title: Video game actors go on strike over AI
Canadian wildfire grew so intense it made its own weather
item.description: Jasper National Park, a treasured site in Canada, faced devastation as two large wildfires swept through the area. The inferno destroyed 358 out of 1,113 buildings. Experts noted the wildfires created their own weather, forming pyrocumulonimbus storms which intensified the fires, making them nearly impossible to extinguish and extremely dangerous for firefighters.

item.title: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe announces plans to contest polls
Apartheid massacre site on World Heritage list
item.description: UNESCO added sites linked to South Africa's apartheid struggle, including a massacre scene and Nelson Mandela's childhood village, to its World Heritage List. Other notable additions include Italy’s Appian Way and Japan’s Sado mines. The Appian Way is famed for its historical significance, while the Sado mines are noted for their artisanal techniques.

item.title: RFK Jr has enough signatures to appear on Nevada ballot: Officials
item.description: Nevada election officials confirmed Robert F. Kennedy Jr. will appear on the state's ballot, likely impacting Republican and Democratic dominance. This development follows his failure to qualify for the CNN debate in June. Over 22,000 verified signatures far exceeded the required threshold. His running mate, Nicole Shanahan, was chosen in March. Legal challenges may still arise.

item.title: Israel strike on Gaza school kills at least 30
item.description: An Israeli airstrike on a school in Deir Al-Balah, Gaza, killed at least 30 Palestinians, including 15 children and eight women. Over 100 people were injured. Israel claimed the attack targeted militants using the compound. The Israeli military also instructed the evacuation of Khan Younis for a forceful operation against militant groups, resulting in 14 more deaths.
